title: Game Design-Based Collaborative Mathematical Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematics concepts and simple programming experience
context.additional_context: Learners work in teams on game design tasks, using a wiki-based LMS for collaborative information search and knowledge construction. They use personal devices in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) format in real-time online environments, aiming to enhance mathematical thinking through problem-based learning activities

learning_goals: Learners can solve over 80% of mathematical problems encountered in game design through collaborative information-seeking strategies.
Using the wiki LMSâ€™s content and social features, learners can create and share team-based knowledge-building documents.
Through problem-based learning, learners can apply mathematical concepts to actual game mechanics at least three times.
In formative assessments, learners can perform self- and peer evaluations of collaborative problem-solving processes at least twice.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
